content.question: A ceramic mug is removed from a pottery kiln once the mug reaches a temperature of 700 degrees Celsius. The temperature of the mug then decreases at a rate given by <math alttext="r of t, equals, the fraction with numerator 20 plus, 100 times arc tangent t, and denominator 1 plus t, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>100</mn><mi>arctan</mi><mo>‚Å°</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> degrees Celsius per minute, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of minutes since being removed from the kiln. What is the temperature of the mug, to the nearest degree Celsius, at time <math alttext="t equals 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
